content: President Obama Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 61.8% Disapprove 32.3% Congressional Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 34.3% Disapprove 59.0% Direction of Country RCP Average: Right Direction 36.6% Wrong Track 56.7% I think you're reading too much between the lines. Wrong track 56.7% does not give a particular good outlook. Secondly, Jimmy Carter at 100 days into his term boasted a 63% approval rating. I'd say one more strike and you're out.
reply: President Obama Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 61.8% Disapprove 32.3% Congressional Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 34.3% Disapprove 59.0% Direction of Country RCP Average: Right Direction 36.6% Wrong Track 56.7% I think you're reading too much between the lines. Wrong track 56.7% does not give a particular good outlook. Secondly, Jimmy Carter at 100 days into his term boasted a 63% approval rating. I'd say one more strike and you're out.
title: AP Poll: Americans high on Obama, direction of US

content: Whenever someone posts an article about a poll, I never read the article but look at the poll itself. Here is a link to the actual poll: "http://www.ap-gfkpoll.com/pdf/AP-GfK_Poll_Topline_April_2009.pdf" Here is some interesting info from the poll: Polled: Democrats 48%, Republicans 28% "Overall, please tell me whether you approve, disapprove, or neither approve nor disapprove of the way Congress is handling its job." Strongly Approve 7%, Strongly Disapprove 34% "Overall, please tell me whether you approve, disapprove, or neither approve nor disapprove of the way the Democrats in Congress are handling the economy?" Strongly Approve 16%, Strongly Disapprove 30% "How worried are you that increasing federal debt will harm the financial future of your children and grandchildren?" Very Worried 49%, Not at All Worried 9% "Generally speaking, would you say things in this country are heading in the right direction or in the wrong direction?" Right Direction 48%, Wrong Direction 44% Margin of Error: 3.1% It seems from this poll that people are still oblivious to the fact that Congress and the POTUS are working together on their agenda for this country. It is only a matter of time before people start "wisening up" and then watch what these polls say.
reply: Whenever someone posts an article about a poll, I never read the article but look at the poll itself. Here is a link to the actual poll: "http://www.ap-gfkpoll.com/pdf/AP-GfK_Poll_Topline_April_2009.pdf" Here is some interesting info from the poll: Polled: Democrats 48%, Republicans 28% "Overall, please tell me whether you approve, disapprove, or neither approve nor disapprove of the way Congress is handling its job." Strongly Approve 7%, Strongly Disapprove 34% "Overall, please tell me whether you approve, disapprove, or neither approve nor disapprove of the way the Democrats in Congress are handling the economy?" Strongly Approve 16%, Strongly Disapprove 30% "How worried are you that increasing federal debt will harm the financial future of your children and grandchildren?" Very Worried 49%, Not at All Worried 9% "Generally speaking, would you say things in this country are heading in the right direction or in the wrong direction?" Right Direction 48%, Wrong Direction 44% Margin of Error: 3.1% It seems from this poll that people are still oblivious to the fact that Congress and the POTUS are working together on their agenda for this country. It is only a matter of time before people start "wisening up" and then watch what these polls say.
title: AP Poll: Americans high on Obama, direction of US

Sanctions can't work without isolating Iran, and his strategy appears to be working. Seems to be doing a good job in that department. Dave

title: AP Poll: Americans high on Obama, direction of US

content: President Obama Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 61.8% Disapprove 32.3% Congressional Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 34.3% Disapprove 59.0% Direction of Country RCP Average: Right Direction 36.6% Wrong Track 56.7% I think you're reading too much between the lines. Wrong track 56.7% does not give a particular good outlook. Secondly, Jimmy Carter at 100 days into his term boasted a 63% approval rating. I'd say one more strike and you're out.
reply: President Obama Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 61.8% Disapprove 32.3% Congressional Job Approval RCP Average: Approve 34.3% Disapprove 59.0% Direction of Country RCP Average: Right Direction 36.6% Wrong Track 56.7% I think you're reading too much between the lines. Wrong track 56.7% does not give a particular good outlook. Secondly, Jimmy Carter at 100 days into his term boasted a 63% approval rating. I'd say one more strike and you're out.
title: AP Poll: Americans high on Obama, direction of US

content: Whenever someone posts an article about a poll, I never read the article but look at the poll itself. Here is a link to the actual poll: "http://www.ap-gfkpoll.com/pdf/AP-GfK_Poll_Topline_April_2009.pdf" Here is some interesting info from the poll: Polled: Democrats 48%, Republicans 28% "Overall, please tell me whether you approve, disapprove, or neither approve nor disapprove of the way Congress is handling its job." Strongly Approve 7%, Strongly Disapprove 34% "Overall, please tell me whether you approve, disapprove, or neither approve nor disapprove of the way the Democrats in Congress are handling the economy?" Strongly Approve 16%, Strongly Disapprove 30% "How worried are you that increasing federal debt will harm the financial future of your children and grandchildren?" Very Worried 49%, Not at All Worried 9% "Generally speaking, would you say things in this country are heading in the right direction or in the wrong direction?" Right Direction 48%, Wrong Direction 44% Margin of Error: 3.1% It seems from this poll that people are still oblivious to the fact that Congress and the POTUS are working together on their agenda for this country. It is only a matter of time before people start "wisening up" and then watch what these polls say.
reply: Whenever someone posts an article about a poll, I never read the article but look at the poll itself. Strongly Approve 7%, Strongly Disapprove 34% "Overall, please tell me whether you approve, disapprove, or neither approve nor disapprove of the way the Democrats in Congress are handling the economy?" Strongly Approve 16%, Strongly Disapprove 30% "How worried are you that increasing federal debt will harm the financial future of your children and grandchildren?" Very Worried 49%, Not at All Worried 9% "Generally speaking, would you say things in this country are heading in the right direction or in the wrong direction?" Right Direction 48%, Wrong Direction 44% Margin of Error: 3.1% It seems from this poll that people are still oblivious to the fact that Congress and the POTUS are working together on their agenda for this country. It is only a matter of time before people start "wisening up" and then watch what these polls say.

content: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Bailouts?...what are those? Im just hearing about caterpillars, terrorists, and grown men getting water splashed in their face President Obama is a good leader, that is for sure, but his national defense policies are totally against what I believe. And what would that be...bomb everyone who doesn't agree with our policies. We already know your opinion on torture, so what ARE the national defense policies you believe in? I've noticed President Obama and his administration have shut their mouths on the issue of Iran since Ahmadinejad gave yet another racist, anti-semetic rant at the UN Conference on racism... I HOPE they got the message... This whole going around the world apologizing, and shaking the hands of dictators is not exactly an image of strength...it is an image of a defeat nation resigning itself to less than a super-power status. Maybe Obama thinks that, I don't. Actually, Obama appears to very successful in isolating Iran. Instead of name calling, vituperation, stupid threats that he had no intention of carrying out, Obama is on the one hand, making serious offers of relaxing tension, while at the same time sticking to the bottom line of no nukes. Sanctions can't work without isolating Iran, and his strategy appears to be working. Seems to be doing a good job in that department. Dave

I've noticed President Obama and his administration have shut their mouths on the issue of Iran since Ahmadinejad gave yet another racist, anti-semetic rant at the UN Conference on racism... I HOPE they got the message... This whole going around the world apologizing, and shaking the hands of dictators is not exactly an image of strength...it is an image of a defeat nation resigning itself to less than a super-power status. Maybe Obama thinks that, I don't.
reply: Actually, Obama appears to very successful in isolating Iran. Instead of name calling, vituperation, stupid threats that he had no intention of carrying out, Obama is on the one hand, making serious offers of relaxing tension, while at the same time sticking to the bottom line of no nukes. Sanctions can't work without isolating Iran, and his strategy appears to be working. Seems to be doing a good job in that department. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Well he has a lot on his plate. I hope he put health care reform at the very top and we really get something done in that area. 2nd on my list is the taxes. I am going to write him and tell him how popular he would be if he inacts the fairtax. No it's not perfect gentlemen, but it will bring jobs back in this country. That's the bottom line. When you do write, be sure to ask him how health care reform will be paid for! In fact, ask how he plans on reducing the monumental debt he has laid on all of us--and still more to come!
